origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Advertising copywriter and executive with Leo Burnett agency in Chicago, Ill. Consists of scripts for radio spots, and a scrapbook of promotional work for the Toronto Daily Star newspaper want ads section. Companies represented include Libby, McNeill & Libby, Nash-Kelvinator and Pure Oil. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Advertising copywriter and executive with Leo Burnett agency in Chicago, Ill. Worked at Allis-Chalmers and Toronto Daily Star newspaper before joining Leo Burnett as a copywriter in 1938. Promoted to copy supervisor in 1956 before moving to Kenyon & Eckhardt.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The John W. Crawford papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2012. Gift of Elaine Eisner.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John W. Crawford papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm Microfilm Investigations;
J. Walter Thompson Company. 35mm Microfilm Proofs;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Norman H. Strouse papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Shirley F. Woodell papers;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Consists of scripts for radio spots, and a scrapbook of promotional work for the Toronto Daily Star newspaper want ads section. Companies represented include Libby, McNeill & Libby, Nash-Kelvinator and Pure Oil. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
